content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks in Markdown
    julia_code_block = r"```julia\n([^\n]+\n*)+```"m

    # Match all the Julia code blocks in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    for match in matches
        # Get the captured group(s) from the match
        captures = match.captures
        if !isempty(captures)
            # Join all lines within each code block with a newline
            block_code = join([String(x) for x in captures], "\n")
            # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the block code
            clean_code = replace(block_code, r"^(\s*|\s*$)" => "")
            # Append the clean code to the extracted code string
            extracted_code *= clean_code * "\n"
        end
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
